column4: How can I disable the graphical startup (ubuntu logo while the system starts up)
permanently, or just for one boot?
do you want it gone, or do you just want to have it show the boot screen as well as a description of what's happening?
either way, do alt-f2 then type "gksudo gedit /boot/grub/menu.lst"
no, I want it gone, my system does not support it and I only see a blank screen
okay. Do you have the menu.lst file open?
yep, O remove something from the kernel line, right?
no, that will work, but not well.
the thing is, any kernel updates will put it back to the original.
so I want you to find a line that says "defoptions"
then open a terminal and type this: sudo grub-update
